blocks.name: frpomin
blocks.content: Every (possibly proper) subclass of a class ` A ` with a founded, partial-ordering, set-like relation ` R ` has a minimal element. The additional condition of partial ordering over ~ frmin enables avoiding infinity. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 11-Feb-2022.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: frpomin2
blocks.content: Every (possibly proper) subclass of a class ` A ` with a founded, partial-ordering, set-like relation ` R ` has a minimal element. The additional condition of partial ordering over ~ frmin enables avoiding infinity. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 11-Feb-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm frpomin2(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(w3a(wfr(c0, c1), wpo(c0, c1), wse(c0, c1)), wa(wss(c2, c1), wne(c2, emptycls))), wrex(s0, c2, wceq(cpred(c0, c2, cv(s0)), emptycls)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
} = {
  sylibr(wa(w3a(wfr(c0, c1), wpo(c0, c1), wse(c0, c1)), wa(wss(c2, c1), wne(c2, emptycls))), wrex(s0, c2, wceq(cpred(c0, c2, cv(s0)), emptycls)), wrex(s0, c2, wral(hs0, c2, wn(wbr(cv(hs0), c0, cv(s0))))))
  frpomin(s0, hs0, c0, c1, c2)
  rexbii(s0, c2, wceq(cpred(c0, c2, cv(s0)), emptycls), wral(hs0, c2, wn(wbr(cv(hs0), c0, cv(s0)))))
  bitri(wceq(cpred(c0, c2, cv(s0)), emptycls), wral(hs0, c2, wn(wbr(cv(hs0), c0, cv(s0)))), wceq(crab(hs0, c2, wbr(cv(hs0), c0, cv(s0))), emptycls))
  eqeq1i(cpred(c0, c2, cv(s0)), emptycls, crab(hs0, c2, wbr(cv(hs0), c0, cv(s0))))
  dfpred3(hs0, c0, c2, cv(s0))
  vex(s0)
  rabeq0(hs0, c2, wbr(cv(hs0), c0, cv(s0)))
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(cv(s0))
}

  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)

blocks.name: frpoind
blocks.content: The principle of founded induction over a partial ordering. This theorem is a version of ~ frind that does not require infinity, and can be used to prove ~ wfi and ~ tfi . (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 11-Feb-2022.)

blocks.name: frpoinsg
blocks.content: Founded, Partial-Ordering Induction Schema. If a property passes from all elements less than ` y ` of a founded, partially-ordered class ` A ` to ` y ` itself (induction hypothesis), then the property holds for all elements of ` A ` . (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 11-Feb-2022.)

blocks.name: frmin
blocks.content: Every (possibly proper) subclass of a class ` A ` with a founded, set-like relation ` R ` has a minimal element. Lemma 4.3 of Don Monk's notes for Advanced Set Theory, which can be found at ~ http://euclid.colorado.edu/~~monkd/settheory . This is a very strong generalization of ~ tz6.26 and ~ tz7.5 . (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 4-Feb-2011.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 26-Jun-2015.)

blocks.name: frind
blocks.content: The principle of founded induction. Theorem 4.4 of Don Monk's notes (see ~ frmin ). This principle states that if ` B ` is a subclass of a founded class ` A ` with the property that every element of ` B ` whose initial segment is included in ` A ` is itself equal to ` A ` . Compare ~ wfi and ~ tfi , which are special cases of this theorem that do not require the axiom of infinity to prove. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 6-Feb-2011.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 26-Jun-2015.)

blocks.name: frindi
blocks.content: The principle of founded induction. Theorem 4.4 of Don Monk's notes (see ~ frmin ). This principle states that if ` B ` is a subclass of a founded class ` A ` with the property that every element of ` B ` whose initial segment is included in ` A ` is itself equal to ` A ` . (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 6-Feb-2011.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 26-Jun-2015.)

blocks.name: frinsg
blocks.content: Founded Induction Schema. If a property passes from all elements less than ` y ` of a founded class ` A ` to ` y ` itself (induction hypothesis), then the property holds for all elements of ` A ` . (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 7-Feb-2011.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 26-Jun-2015.)
